text: there used to be a time when we were
less
populous that we were just simply
another Predator out there we were a
hunter and a gatherer and we did our job
as other species do in helping to
control some species whose numbers might
get out of whack if something wasn't
predating on them then we developed
Agriculture and again until we became so
numerous that we had to
start
doing um non-ecological forms of
Agriculture like huge
monocultures or chemically Force feeding
the land uh a lot of our agriculture was
very helpful to some other species um I
didn't use this in the book but uh
actually I use this in another book once
uh there used to
be uh traditional
farming uh among the tono oam Indians
also known as the Papago Indians in
Southern
Arizona um where they would use um they
would Channel sheet flooding during the
summer rains into big washes that allow
them to cultivate the native species
that they lived on and they used to be
in what is today Organ Pipe National
Park well when that Park was formed the
people were kicked out of there because
uh the park rangers said this is for
wildlife not for people well the Indians
had to leave and half the bird species
left with them they were adapted to
living around these people and you know
their seeds now in this book the world
without us I talk about how um a
complimentary relationship has developed
over millions excuse me thousands of
years uh between traditional nomadic
pastoralists who move cattle around uh
parts of Eastern Africa and elephant
herds who tend to follow them the cattle
will graze a piece of land until the
grass is gone and then they move them on
and whenever you graze land Woody
species will invade and replace the
grass well elephants love the stripping
the bark off of Woody species they eat
trees so then the elephants move in and
then when they eat all those things then
the grass comes in and there has been
this lovely cycle going on for a long
time that has only been interrupted
recently when Real Estate uh values have
now imposed fences on Africa and Nomads
can no long longer be
nomadic uh obviously when we become so
numerous that we start clearing away a
lot of habitats for growing food that's
when the problems began but we were in
Fairly good shape up until really the 20
20th century when our numbers doubled
and then redoubled
